value.name: Residents raise concerns about vacant buildings after string of unsolved fires
value.description: Residents in the Booker Washington Heights community are looking at their neighbors, or lack thereof, after a string of unsolved fires burned buildings over the last week. The Columbia Police Department and the Columbia Richland County Fire Department are investigating fires at vacant homes on the 3400 Block of Carver Street and the 2600 Block of High Circle.

value.name: One year after protests, activist leaders say more work needs to be done
value.description: Tuesday, May 25 marked one year since a former Minneapolis Police Officer murdered George Floyd. A viral video of Floyd’s death triggered protests across the country, including in Columbia. Out of those protests came a list of demands from the organization Empower SC.

value.name: Columbia shooting comes just days after sheriff desperately called for end to gun violence
value.description: Data from the Columbia Police Department and the Richland County Sheriff’s Department shows that year over year, more people are dying from gun violence, and 2021 is outpacing years past. To address the issue,
